item.title: Dorothy Bishop
item.description:
This is intended as serious question for #neuroscience Mastodon, not as snark.
Re neuroscience biomarkers of individual differences.
Are there any findings of significant correlations between:
a) fMRI activation in a given ROI
b) A cognitive/emotional/behavioural phenotype
that have been replicated by a different research group?
I'm also interested in same question where (a) is an EEG/ERP component.
And in both clinical and nonclinical samples.
Thanks!

item.title: Manlio De Domenico
item.description: I am not a fan of IIT, but to be honest it seems that a tribal fight is ongoing.As a scientist, I have seen (and am still seeing) some speculations in magazines, top journals (as opinion pieces), in social media for a variety of topics, from quantum mechanics to Complex systems. It might be disappointing, but it's what it is.To claim that one theory is pseudoscience (even if it is), at least I'd expect to have a special issue in some domain journal, with peer reviewed papers that highlights both strength and weaknesses of the alternative theories and the attacked one (represented by distinct groups). We need to support each claim with papers, not (only) posts on Twitter, blogs, preprints, etc.Pol√≠tics, publish or perish mindset, egocentrism, etc etc are intoxicating science. We have the duty to use the scientific method every time, at each step. We shouldn't forget it. Not defending IIT today. But if we are fine with today's tribal fight then we must be ready to face hard times in the future.
